t: Joel 2
The Day of the Lord
Blow*pn the trumpet in Zion, And*ld sound an alarm in My holy mountain! Let*ld all the inhabitants of the land tremble; For*ld the day of the Lord*s is coming, For*ld it is at hand:

A*ld day of darkness and gloominess, A*ld day of clouds and thick darkness, Like*ld the morning clouds*i spread over the mountains. A*ld people come,*i great and strong, The*ld like of whom has never been; Nor*ld will there ever be any such*i after them, Even*ld for many successive generations.
A*ln fire devours before them, And*ld behind them a flame burns; The*ld land is*i like the Garden of Eden before them, And*ld behind them a desolate wilderness; Surely*ld nothing shall escape them.
Their*ld appearance is like the appearance of horses; And*ld like swift steeds, so they run.
With*ld a noise like chariots Over*ld mountaintops they leap, Like*ld the noise of a flaming fire that devours the stubble, Like*ld a strong people set in battle array.
Before*ln them the people writhe in pain; All*ld faces are drained of color.
They*ld run like mighty men, They*ld climb the wall like men of war; Every*ld one marches in formation, And*ld they do not break ranks.
They*ld do not push one another; Every*ld one marches in his own column. Though*ld they lunge between the weapons, They*ld are not cut down.
They*ld run to and fro in the city, They*ld run on the wall; They*ld climb into the houses, They*ld enter at the windows like a thief.
The*ln earth quakes before them, The*ld heavens tremble; The*ld sun and moon grow dark, And*ld the stars diminish their brightness.

The*ld Lord*s gives voice before His army, For*ld His camp is very great; For*ld strong is*i the*i One*i who executes His word. For*ld the day of the Lord*s is*i great and very terrible; Who*ld can endure it?
A Call to Repentance
“Now,*pn therefore,” says the Lord,*s “Turn*ld to Me with all your heart, With*ld fasting, with weeping, and with mourning.”
So*ld rend your heart, and not your garments; Return*ld to the Lord*s your God, For*ld He is*i gracious and merciful, Slow*ld to anger, and of great kindness; And*ld He relents from doing harm.
Who*ld knows if*i He will turn and relent, And*ld leave a blessing behind Him— A*ld grain offering and a drink offering For*ld the Lord*s your God?
Blow*ld the trumpet in Zion, Consecrate*ld a fast, Call*ld a sacred assembly;

Gather*ld the people, Sanctify*ld the congregation, Assemble*ld the elders, Gather*ld the children and nursing babes; Let*ld the bridegroom go out from his chamber, And*ld the bride from her dressing room.

Let*ld the priests, who minister to the Lord,*s Weep*ld between the porch and the altar; Let*ld them say, “Spare Your people, O Lord,*s And*ld do not give Your heritage to reproach, That*ld the nations should rule over them. Why*ld should they say among the peoples, ‘Where*ld is*i their God?’”
The Land Refreshed
Then*pn the Lord*s will be zealous for His land, And*ld pity His people.

The*ld Lord*s will answer and say to His people, “Behold,*ld I will send you grain and new wine and oil, And*ld you will be satisfied by them; I*ld will no longer make you a reproach among the nations.

“But*ln I will remove far from you the northern army,*i And*ld will drive him away into a barren and desolate land, With*ld his face toward the eastern sea And*ld his back toward the western sea; His*ld stench will come up, And*ld his foul odor will rise, Because*ld he has done monstrous things.”
Fear*ln not, O land; Be*ld glad and rejoice, For*ld the Lord*s has done marvelous things!
Do*ld not be afraid, you beasts of the field; For*ld the open pastures are springing up, And*ld the tree bears its fruit; The*ld fig tree and the vine yield their strength.

Be*ld glad then, you children of Zion, And*ld rejoice in the Lord*s your God; For*ld He has given you the former rain faithfully, And*ld He will cause the rain to come down for you— The*ld former rain, And*ld the latter rain in the first month.*i
The*ld threshing floors shall be full of wheat, And*ld the vats shall overflow with new wine and oil.
“So*ln I will restore to you the years that the swarming locust has eaten, The*ld crawling locust, The*ld consuming locust, And*ld the chewing locust, My*ld great army which I sent among you.
You*ld shall eat in plenty and be satisfied, And*ld praise the name of the Lord*s your God, Who*ld has dealt wondrously with you; And*ld My people shall never be put to shame.
Then*ld you shall know that I am*i in the midst of Israel: I*ld am*i the Lord*s your God And*ld there is no other. My*ld people shall never be put to shame.
God’s Spirit Poured Out

“And*pn it shall come to pass afterward That*ld I will pour out My Spirit on all flesh; Your*ld sons and your daughters shall prophesy, Your*ld old men shall dream dreams, Your*ld young men shall see visions.
And*ld also on My*i menservants and on My*i maidservants I*ld will pour out My Spirit in those days.
“And*ln I will show wonders in the heavens and in the earth: Blood*ld and fire and pillars of smoke.
The*ld sun shall be turned into darkness, And*ld the moon into blood, Before*ld the coming of the great and awesome day of the Lord.*s

And*ld it shall come to pass That*ild whoever calls on the name of the Lord*s Shall*ld be saved. For*ld in Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there shall be deliverance, As*ld the Lord*s has said, Among*ld the remnant whom the Lord*s calls.
